article:
I do a lot of management training each year for the Circle K Corporation, a national chain of convenience stores. During these discussions, I ask the participants, "What has caused you to stay long enough to become a   _  ?
    A new manager called Cynthia took the   _    and slowly, with her voice almost breaking, said, "It was a $19 baseball glove." She told the group that when she started to work in this   _  , she received a phone call from her nine-year-old son, Jessie. He   _  a baseball glove for Little League. Cynthia had   _   he would get a glove as soon as she found a job and he was calling to   _   her of her promise.
    When Cynthia   _   for work the next morning, Patricia, the store manager, asked her to come to the small room in back of the store that   _   as an office. Cynthia   _   if she had done something wrong or   _   some part of her job unfinished from the day before. She was worried and   _  .
    Patricia handed her a box. "I overheard you talking to your son yesterday," she said, "and I knew that it is hard to explain such things to kids. This is a baseball glove for Jessie because he needs to understand how   _   he is, even though you have to pay bills before you can buy gloves as a single mother. You know we can't   _  each good person like you as much as we would like to; but we do   _  , and I want you to know you are important to us."
    The thoughtfulness, sympathy and love of this convenience store manager   _   her. She remembers better how much an employer cares than how much the employer pays.
